title: Which dissolves faster in hot and cold water, sugar or salt? How & why? - Quora

response.answer_text: All solutes will dissolve more into “hot” solvent than they would “cold” solvent. “Sugar” and “salt” are both general terms for groups of compounds that have similar characteristics. I,ll assume you mean “table” types which is “Sucrose” and“sodium chloride”. Between these two, sucrose wins having 1g dissolving in 0.5ml of room temperature water (or in 0.2ml of boiling water). 1.0g of NaCl dissolves in 2.8ml of room temperature (25°C) water and about 2.6ml of boiling water.
